Class OPLTest

java.lang.Object
OPLTest
public class OPLTest
extends java.lang.Object
OPL Unit Tests These tests are fully automatic and do not require any manual steps.
Author:
Michael Markiewicz

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    OPLTest()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void setUp()
    Redirects any standard system output to a print steam.
    void tearDown()
    Restores system output to display
    void testHandleTieIllegalArguments()
    Tests the HandleTie function for illegal arguments (nonpositive numbers)
    void testOPLConstructor()
    Tests normal OPL constructor.
    void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionEmptyParties()
    Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty
    void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveNumBallots()
    Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty
    void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveSeats()
    Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty
    void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNullParties()
    Tests exception thrown from constructor when "null" is passed as the parties parameter
    void testOPLLessCandidatesThanSeats()
    This function will run an election where there are less candidates than seats up for election.
    void testOPLOutput()
    Ensures that the output to the console, audit file, and media report are expected outputs.
    void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckFilesCreated()
    Checks if running the OPL Voting Algorithm creates a media and audit report in correct format.
    void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckWinners()
    Ensures that the most popular candidate(s) of each party was elected depending on the number of seats won.
    void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmFirstAllocation()
    Tests that the remaining votes and number of seats of each party matches how much they should have after the first allocation.
    void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmSecondAllocationNumSeats()
    Ensures that the number of seats each party has after the election is as expected.
    void testOPLTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput()
    Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a candidate tie matches the expected output from a tie.
    void testOPLTiedPartiesAndTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput()
    Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a party tie and candidate tie matches the expected output from a tie.
    void testOPLTiedPartiesExpectedOutput()
    Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a party tie matches the expected output from a tie.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • OPLTest

      public OPLTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Redirects any standard system output to a print steam.

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach public void tearDown()
      Restores system output to display

    • testHandleTieIllegalArguments

      @Test public void testHandleTieIllegalArguments()
      Tests the HandleTie function for illegal arguments (nonpositive numbers)

    • testOPLConstructor

      @Test public void testOPLConstructor()
      Tests normal OPL constructor.

    • testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNullParties

      @Test public void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNullParties()
      Tests exception thrown from constructor when "null" is passed as the parties parameter

    • testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionEmptyParties

      @Test public void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionEmptyParties()
      Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty

    • testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveNumBallots

      @Test public void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveNumBallots()
      Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty

    • testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveSeats

      @Test public void testOPLConstructorThrowsExceptionNonPositiveSeats()
      Tests exception thrown from constructor when the parties parameter is initialized but empty

    • testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckFilesCreated

      @Test public void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckFilesCreated()
      Checks if running the OPL Voting Algorithm creates a media and audit report in correct format. This will delete any preexisting media/audit reports before running the algorithm to ensure new ones are created.

    • testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmFirstAllocation

      @Test public void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmFirstAllocation()
      Tests that the remaining votes and number of seats of each party matches how much they should have after the first allocation.

    • testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmSecondAllocationNumSeats

      @Test public void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmSecondAllocationNumSeats()
      Ensures that the number of seats each party has after the election is as expected. This test does not induce ties.

    • testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckWinners

      @Test public void testOPLRunVotingAlgorithmCheckWinners()
      Ensures that the most popular candidate(s) of each party was elected depending on the number of seats won. Does not induce any ties.

    • testOPLOutput

      @Test public void testOPLOutput()
      Ensures that the output to the console, audit file, and media report are expected outputs. This works by running the algorithm, and comparing the outputs to example output files (ExampleOPLOutput.txt, ExampleOPLAudit.txt, ExampleOPLMedia.txt) The tests are designed in such a way where ties should not happen so output should be the same each time.

    • testOPLLessCandidatesThanSeats

      @Test public void testOPLLessCandidatesThanSeats()
      This function will run an election where there are less candidates than seats up for election. The expected output of running the algorithm would be that everyone gets a seat but there are still seats left in the election.

    • testOPLTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput

      @Test public void testOPLTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput()
      Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a candidate tie matches the expected output from a tie.

    • testOPLTiedPartiesExpectedOutput

      @Test public void testOPLTiedPartiesExpectedOutput()
      Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a party tie matches the expected output from a tie. This function is very similar to testOPLTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput

    • testOPLTiedPartiesAndTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput

      @Test public void testOPLTiedPartiesAndTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput()
      Tests to see if the output from running an OPL algorithm with a party tie and candidate tie matches the expected output from a tie. This function is very similar to testOPLTiedCandidatesExpectedOutput and testOPLTiedPartiesExpectedOutput, but this one focuses on the case where candidates tie in addition to a party tie.
